item.title: Major Stripe investor Sequoia confirms $70B valuation, offers its investors a payday
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Payments giant Stripe has delayed going public for so long that its major investor Sequoia Capital is getting creative to offer returns to its limited partners. The venture firm emailed LPs in funds raised between 2009 and 2011 with an offer to buy up to $861 million worth of shares in Stripe, Axios reported. Sequoia […]

item.title: Google’s Kurian approached Wiz, $23B deal could take a week to land, source says
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden, Marina Temkin
item.description:
Alphabet, Google’s parent company, is in advanced talks to acquire Wiz for $23 billion, a person close to the company told TechCrunch. The deal discussions were previously reported by the Wall Street Journal. Wiz, a cybersecurity startup founded in 2020, was approached a few weeks ago by Thomas Kurian, head of Google’s cloud division, the […]

item.title: Bird Buddy’s new AI feature lets people name and identify individual birds
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Name That Bird determines individual members of a species by identifying distinguishing characteristics that most humans would be hard-pressed to spot.

item.title: YouTube Music is testing an AI-generated radio feature and adding a song recognition tool
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
YouTube Music is introducing two new ways to boost song discovery on its platform. YouTube announced on Monday that it’s experimenting with an AI-generated conversational radio feature, and rolling out a new Shazam-like tool to help users discover the name of a song by singing, humming or playing parts of it. The new AI-generated conversational […]

item.description:

item.title: Deezer chases Spotify and Amazon Music with its own AI playlist generator
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Deezer is the latest music streaming app to introduce an AI playlist feature. The company announced on Monday that a select number of paid users will be able to create custom playlists with a text prompt using its “Playlist with AI” feature. The launch of the new feature comes a few months after Spotify and […]

item.title: Caliza lands $8.5 million to bring real-time money transfers to Latin America using USDC
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
Real-time payments are becoming commonplace for individuals and businesses, but not yet for cross-border transactions. That’s what Caliza is hoping to change, starting with Latin America. Founded in 2021 by American entrepreneur Ezra Kebrab, who now lives in São Paulo, Brazil, Caliza offers an alternative to transfers made via SWIFT, which are the norm in […]

item.title: How VanMoof’s new owners plan to win over its old customers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
When VanMoof declared bankruptcy last year, it left around 5,000 customers who had preordered e-bikes in the lurch. Now VanMoof is up and running under new management, and the company’s current owners are courting those same customers by offering them a €1,000 discount off a new bike.  It’s an audacious strategy, one that bets on […]

item.title: Mitti Labs aims to make rice farming less harmful to the climate, starting in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Mitti Labs aims to transform rice farming in India and other South Asian markets by reducing methane emissions by 50% and water consumption by 30%.

item.title: Hank Green reckons with the power — and the powerlessness — of the creator

item.description:
Hank Green has had a while to think about how social media has changed us.
